definition: to course the liver and rectify 氣|气[qi4] (TCM)
to dredge/to clear away obstruction/thin/sparse/scanty/distant (relation)/not close/to neglect/negligent/to present a memorial to the Emperor/commentary/annotation
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Objective To observe the effect of dredging liver to regulate qi and remove stasis in the treatment of primary dysmenorrhea.
sentences.chinese: 目的观察疏肝理气化瘀法治疗功能性痛经的疗效。

definition: to invigorate blood circulation and alleviate pain (idiom)
to alleviate fever (medicine)/to clear internal heat (Chinese medicine)
to relieve (cold, rheumatic pain etc)/lit. to dispel pathogenic wind (TCM)
(in Chinese medicine) stasis (of blood or other fluids)
(TCM) to rectify 氣|气[qi4] and transform phlegm
conversant with the Confucian classics/to stimulate menstrual flow (TCM)
